formName: C118 section 6 part 3 apply for Authorised Economic Operator

sections.title: What is your Economic Operator Registration and Identification (EORI) number?

fields.label: What is your Economic Operator Registration and Identification (EORI) number?
fields.helpText: Enter your country code, for example GB, and then your up to 15 numerical digit EORI number

fields.label: Why am I being asked for this?
fields.infoText: We use your EORI number to link together all forms for your application

fields.label: Member states country codes
fields.infoText:
Code and Country:

**GB United Kingdom**

BE Belgium

BG Bulgaria

CZ Czechia

DK Denmark

DE Germany

EE Estonia

HU Hungary

AT Austria

PL Poland

SL Slovenia

FI Finland

SE Sweden

sections.title: Is access to cargo units subject to rules or restrictions?

fields.label: Is access to cargo units subject to rules or restrictions?
fields.shortName: 6.4.1: Access to cargo units subject to rules/restrictions
fields.helpText: Ref 6.4.1. For example, monitoring of cargo units. For more information see AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 4
fields.errorMessage: Select whether there is access to cargo units subject to rules/restrictions

sections.title: How are the access restrictions for cargo units enforced?

fields.label: How are the access restrictions for cargo units enforced?
fields.shortName: 6.4.1: Details of enforcement of access restrictions
fields.helpText: Ref 6.4.1. For example, containers, swap bodies or transport boxes

sections.title: Briefly describe what measures are in place to prevent unauthorised access to and tampering with cargo units

fields.label: Briefly describe what measures are in place to prevent unauthorised access to and tampering with cargo units
fields.shortName: 6.4.2: Measures to prevent unauthorised access to cargo units
fields.helpText: Ref 6.4.2. For example, constant supervision, training staff and making them aware of risks, seals, instructions on procedures to follow in the case of unauthorised entry

sections.title: Do you use seals to prevent unauthorised tampering with goods?

fields.label: Do you use seals to prevent unauthorised tampering with goods?
fields.shortName: 6.4.3a: Seals used to prevent unauthorised tampering

fields.label: What kind of seals do you use to prevent tampering?
fields.shortName: 6.4.3b: Seals used to prevent unauthorised access to cargo units

fields.label: Which specific seals do these satisfy?
fields.helpText: Ref 6.4.3c. For example, ISO. Enter n/a if not applicable.

sections.title: How do you make sure that goods are not tampered with if seals are not used?

fields.label: How do you make sure that goods are not tampered with if seals are not used?
fields.shortName: 6.4.3d: How I ensure goods are not tampered with

sections.title: What control measures do you use for checking cargo units?

fields.label: What control measures do you use for checking cargo units?
fields.shortName: 6.4.4: Control measures for checking cargo units
fields.helpText: Ref 6.4.4. For example, 7-point inspection process: front wall, left side, right side, floor, covering or roof, inside or outside of doors, outside or undercarriage

fields.label: Who is the owner or operator of the cargo units?
fields.helpText: Ref 6.4.5a. For example, this could be your own business or another

fields.label: Who maintains or repairs the cargo units?
fields.helpText: Ref 6.4.5b. For example, this could be your own business or another

fields.label: Are there regular maintenance plans?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether there are regular maintenance plans

fields.label: Are external maintenance works checked?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether there are external maintenance works checked

fields.label: Which means of transport are normally used by your business?
If your business uses external transport providers, tell us what they are
fields.helpText: Ref 6.5.1b. For example, freight forwarders or carriers. Enter n/a if you use your own transport.

fields.label: How do you establish whether the freight forwarder or carrier meets the required security standards?
fields.helpText: Ref 6.5.1c. For example, by means of a security certificate, declarations or agreements

sections.title: Do you take other measures for outsourced transport activities to meet security standards?

fields.label: Do you take other measures for outsourced transport activities to meet security standards?
fields.shortName: 6.5.1d: Other measures for outsourced transport activities undertaken

sections.title: Is storage of goods outsourced to a third party?

fields.label: Is storage of goods outsourced to a third party?

sections.title: Have you completed all the forms for your application?
sections.shortName: Completion of all C117 and C118 forms
sections.description: You need to send all relevant forms within a 24 hour period, or your application will be rejected.

fields.label: What do I need to complete?
fields.infoText:
If you are applying for AEO status customs simplification (AEOC) you need to complete the following forms:

C117

C118-1-1

C118-1-2

C118-1-3

C118-2

C118-3-1

C118-3-2

C118-4

C118-5


If you are applying for AEO status security and safety (AEOS) you need to complete the following forms:

C117

C118-1-1

C118-1-2

C118-1-3

C118-2

C118-3-1

C118-3-2

C118-4

C118-6-1

C118-6-2

C118-6-3

C118-6-4


If you are applying for both you need to complete the following forms:

C117

C118-1-1

C118-1-2

C118-1-3

C118-2

C118-3-1

C118-3-2

C118-4

C118-5

C118-6-1

C118-6-2

C118-6-3

C118-6-4
### If you are not ready to send all your forms within this period, you need to save and come back later.

fields.label: Provide details below of who is signing the declaration
Full name
Job title
fields.helpText: For example, director, financial controller or secretary

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: We will send an email to this address to confirm we’ve received this form

fields.infoText: By sending this form, you declare that the information you have provided is true and complete.
This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted form.

You need to send us all of the relevant forms within **24 hours**.

If you do not send us these details in time, you will need to start a new application.

If you have sent us all the relevant details, we will tell you within 60 calendar days if your application has been successful.

If your application is unsuccessful we will tell you why.

**If you need help**

[Check the guidance](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/authorised-economic-operator-certification) to find out: 
- what you need to do while we process your application
- how to make changes to your application
- how to contact HMRC about your application
